1. Number Sets

Natural Numbers

$$\mathbb{N} = \{1, 2, 3, 4, \dots\}$$

The set of natural numbers contains all positive integers.

Integers

$$\mathbb{Z} = \{\dots, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, \dots\}$$

The set of integers contains all positive and negative integers as well as zero.

Rational Numbers

$$\mathbb{Q} = \left\{ \frac{p}{q} \mid p \in \mathbb{Z}, q \in \mathbb{N} \right\}$$

The set of rational numbers contains all fractions with integers in the numerator and natural numbers in the denominator.

Real Numbers

$$\mathbb{R}$$

The set of real numbers contains all rational and irrational numbers.

2. Arithmetic Operations

Basic Operations

  • Addition: $a + b$
  • Subtraction: $a - b$
  • Multiplication: $a \cdot b$ or $a \times b$
  • Division: $\frac{a}{b}$ or $a : b$

Mathematical Laws

  • Commutative Law: $a + b = b + a$ and $a \cdot b = b \cdot a$
  • Associative Law: $a + b + c = a + b + c$ and $a \cdot b \cdot c = a \cdot b \cdot c$
  • Distributive Law: $a \cdot b + c = a \cdot b + a \cdot c$

3. Fractions

Basic Rules

  • Addition: $\frac{a}{b} + \frac{c}{d} = \frac{ad + bc}{bd}$
  • Subtraction: $\frac{a}{b} - \frac{c}{d} = \frac{ad - bc}{bd}$
  • Multiplication: $\frac{a}{b} \cdot \frac{c}{d} = \frac{ac}{bd}$
  • Division: $\frac{a}{b} : \frac{c}{d} = \frac{a}{b} \cdot \frac{d}{c} = \frac{ad}{bc}$

Reducing and Expanding

  • Reducing: $\frac{ac}{bc} = \frac{a}{b}$ for $c \neq 0$
  • Expanding: $\frac{a}{b} = \frac{ac}{bc}$ for $c \neq 0$

4. Powers and Roots

Powers

  • Definition: $a^n = \underbrace{a \cdot a \cdot \ldots \cdot a}_{n \text{ factors}}$
  • Powers with negative exponents: $a^{-n} = \frac{1}{a^n}$
  • Powers with rational exponents: $a^{\frac{m}{n}} = \sqrt[n]{a^m}$

Power Rules

  • $a^m \cdot a^n = a^{m+n}$
  • $\frac{a^m}{a^n} = a^{m-n}$
  • $a^m^n = a^{m \cdot n}$
  • $a \cdot b^n = a^n \cdot b^n$
  • $\frac{a}{b}^n = \frac{a^n}{b^n}$

Roots

  • Definition: $\sqrt[n]{a} = b \Leftrightarrow b^n = a$
  • Square root: $\sqrt{a} = \sqrt[2]{a}$
  • Root rules: $\sqrt[n]{a \cdot b} = \sqrt[n]{a} \cdot \sqrt[n]{b}$
  • $\sqrt[n]{\frac{a}{b}} = \frac{\sqrt[n]{a}}{\sqrt[n]{b}}$

5. Logarithms

Definition

$$\log_b(a) = c \Leftrightarrow b^c = a$$

The logarithm to the base $b$ of $a$ is the number $c$ for which: $b$ raised to the power of $c$ equals $a$.

Logarithm Rules

  • $\log_ba \cdot c = \log_ba + \log_bc$
  • $\log_b\frac{a}{c} = \log_ba - \log_bc$
  • $\log_ba^n = n \cdot \log_ba$
  • $\log_b\sqrt[n]{a} = \frac{1}{n} \cdot \log_ba$

Special Logarithms

  • Natural logarithm: $\lna = \log_ea$
  • Common logarithm: $\lga = \log_{10}a$

6. Trigonometry

Important Trigonometric Functions

  • Sine: $\sin\alpha = \frac{\text{opposite}}{\text{hypotenuse}}$
  • Cosine: $\cos\alpha = \frac{\text{adjacent}}{\text{hypotenuse}}$
  • Tangent: $\tan\alpha = \frac{\text{opposite}}{\text{adjacent}}$

Trigonometric Identities

  • $\sin^2\alpha + \cos^2\alpha = 1$
  • $\tan\alpha = \frac{\sin\alpha}{\cos\alpha}$
  • $\sin\alpha + \beta = \sin\alpha\cos\beta + \cos\alpha\sin\beta$
  • $\cos\alpha + \beta = \cos\alpha\cos\beta - \sin\alpha\sin\beta$
